text: Leonard Norman Allmond (1925-2011) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s. Len Allmond was a for the South Sydney Rabbitohs for three seasons between 1947-1949. He played in the Souths team that lost the 1949 Grand Final to St George Dragons 19-12.Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players . 1995 () Len Allmond was also a Flight Sergeant for the RAAF during World War II. WW2 Nominal Roll https://nominal- rolls.dva.gov.au/veteran?id=1030647&c;=WW2 Len Allmond died on 25 September 2011, aged 86 late of Daceyville, New South Wales.Daily Telegraph: Death Notice 28/9/2011 ==References== Category:South Sydney Rabbitohs players Category:Australian rugby league players Category:1925 births Category:2011 deaths Category:Royal Australian Air Force personnel of World War II Category:Place of birth missing
title: Len Allmond
